metadata.title: CVE-2022-3903 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An incorrect read request flaw was found in the Infrared Transceiver USBdriver in the Linux kernel. This issue occurs when a user attaches amalicious USB device. A local user could use this flaw to starve theresources, causing denial of service or potentially crashing the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220
linux-image-4.15.0-209-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-209.220
linux-image-4.15.0-209-lowlatency - 4.15.0-209.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-lowlatency - 4.15.0-209.220
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-147-generic - 5.4.0-147.164~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-209.220').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-147.164~18.04.1').
